humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that the maximum invasive tumor size is grossly estimated to be approximately 5 cm. According to the rules provided, T1 tumors are 2 cm or less, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm, T3 tumors are more than 5 cm, and T4 tumors are of any size with direct extension to the chest wall or skin. Therefore, the tumor size of approximately 5 cm falls into the T2 category.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the maximum invasive tumor size is grossly estimated at approximately 5 cm. According to the TNM staging system for cancer, a T2 stage is defined as a tumor that is 2-5 cm in greatest dimension. Therefore, the T stage for this patient is T2.
